payload.name: mechanism-design
payload.core: Design rules, payoffs, and information structures so self-interested agents' equilibrium behavior produces desired system outcomes. The designer chooses the game; players choose strategies within it.
proc: define goal as measurable social-welfare function
enumerate agent types with private info and actions
identify individual incentives ignoring others' welfare
verify incentive compatibility via revelation principle
stress-test: collusion, sybil, timing, info leakage

diff.game-theoretic: MD chooses rules; game theory predicts behavior given rules
diff.negotiation-coalition: MD designs process before negotiation begins
diff.systems-thinking: MD models strategic agents, not just flows
diff.deontic: MD asks incentive-compatible, not just permitted
diff.mcda: MCDA picks which mechanism; MD designs how it works

fail.desc: metrics become targets and get gamed
mit: rules legible but not fully predictable

rel.name: systems-thinking
rel.why: feedback when mechanisms interact with context

ex.problem: allocate shared conference room among 5 teams claiming high priority
ex.mechanism: second-price auction with weekly-replenishing priority tokens
ex.ic: bidding true value is dominant strategy
ex.robust: collusion unstable as third team wins cheap
